intro: Oxydectes phebalioides, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, also known as the sunflower family. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Oxydectes phebalioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
